profileAlternative.name: Steven Galvin
profileAlternative.headline: Front-End Developer
profileAlternative.summary: I'm a Front-End Developer with a passion for learning and creating. After getting my feet wet with web development ages ago, I decided to dive in full force at the start of 2017. I signed up for Epicodus' 6 month-long immersive Ruby/JavaScript/Rails course. I fell in love with the excitement of learning something new every day and pushing my problem-solving skills to higher levels. Since then I have worked on a multitude of different projects, and I am excited to see where my new found passion of front-end development will take me.

aboutAlternative.text: I'm a Front-End Developer with a passion for learning and creating. After getting my feet wet with web development ages ago, I decided to dive in full force at the start of 2017. I signed up for Epicodus' 6 month-long immersive Ruby/JavaScript/Rails course. I fell in love with the excitement of learning something new every day and pushing my problem-solving skills to higher levels. Since then I have worked on a multitude of different projects, and I am excited to see where my new found passion of front-end development will take me.

positions.title: Front-End Developer
positions.description:
My time as a freelance developer has led me to create many different kinds of projects, some of which include:

– A PHP and MySQL powered blog
– A web app used to randomly generate colors using JavaScript and create savable images using HTML Canvas
– A Ruby on Rails powered blog using SCSS for styles
– An inventory management PWA that scans QR codes and creates log entries. Ruby on Rails backend, React front-end
– A playlist app powered with the JS Library, Amplitude
– Many other projects utilizing libraries and frameworks like jQuery, React, and Angular4, as well as CSS preprocessors like LESS and SCSS.
…
see more

positions.title: Ruby on Rails and React Native Developer
positions.description: My time at ByteShift had me create and manage Rails powered API's to store data for two local businesses. I created a front-end admin side for easy data entry and data modification, and later worked with the front-end team to build apps with React Native that called on the API's I created.

positions.title: Student
positions.description:
Pair programming was a big focus at Epicodus and I learned how to work with many different partners. Learning to overcome obstacles with a partner and effectively troubleshoot our problems was a key skill I walked out with.

I also learned the ins and outs of development. While my focus was Ruby/Rails, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, I also learned the fundamentals of development that gave me the ability to pick up new languages and frameworks with ease.

Most importantly though I learned how to face challenges without fear. Countless times I ran into problems with my code that I couldn't figure out at first, but my time at Epicodus helped me learn how to work through any issue faced, with a team or independently, in a calm and collected manner.
…
see more

educations.title: Portland Community College
educations.degree: Associate of Applied Science – Web Development and Design
